name: CARHARTT Men's Force Relaxed Fit Ripstop Cargo Work Short
reviews: I bought these for my husband to work I'm when the temperatures are way too hot for pants.We own an overhead door business so while installing doors he is really rough on clothes. Carhartt is one of the only brands he works I'm thanks to the durability.These work great. The only con is they run a little small. Had to return the first pair and size up!

reviews: I generally prefer a 'baggy' style of shorts or pants, but these are very comfortable. I find most straight leg styles constricting and snug in the wrong places. These do not have that problem and don't look like they're 3 sizes too large. I recommend them.

name: CARHARTT Men's Force Relaxed Fit Ripstop Cargo Work Short
reviews: Got these for work (I work in a warehouse) and they only lasted about 6 months before ripping, come onnnnnnnn I thought these were carhartt TOUGH?? Granted I would deliver water heaters to plumbers and take back old ones, but it was never super dirt work, I feel like these shouldve gone a year before ripping.. MAAAAAYBE it was from being washed once a week which may have been excessive?? Idk whats up with textiles nowadays.

name: CARHARTT Men's Force Relaxed Fit Ripstop Cargo Work Short
reviews: The material feels like it should be able to stand up to a fair bit of abuse.  I really like the fact that the flaps on the cargo pockets have an opening in the center which allows you to slide things down into the pocket without having to open the flap - my cell phone fits perfectly.  That opening in the threading that attaches the flap to the leg also keeps the pant leg from getting too stiff there and makes them less binding than the legs on my other work shorts.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United States on 5 May 2022
